file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 28-23-07-05 - DEFUELING SHUT-OFF VALVE - ADJUSTMENT/TEST

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL DEFUELING SHUT-OFF VALVE - ADJUSTMENT/TEST EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do the operational check of the refueling/defueling shut-off valve. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT WITH WET DEFUELING SHUT-OFF VALVE - OPERA- 28-23-07-700-801-A WINGSTUB TIONAL CHECK ACFT WITH DRY DEFUELING SHUT-OFF VALVE - OPERA- 28-23-07-700-802-A WINGSTUB TIONAL CHECK EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 28-23-07 Page 1 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-23-07-700-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH WET WINGSTUB 2. DEFUELING SHUT-OFF VALVE - OPERATIONAL CHECK A. General (1) This task is a check of the defueling shut-off valve for operation. This valve permits the defueling of the tanks. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 191 191BR Wing-to-fuselage fairing 155 155EZ Landing gear bay 156 156EZ Landing gear bay D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Operates the refueling/defueling control panel Center lower fairing 1 Monitors the defueling shut-off valve operation Landing gear bay I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Open access panel 191BR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100) to get access to the refueling/ defueling control panel. (2) Remove access panels 155EZ/156EZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100) to get access to the defueling shut-off valve. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 28-23-07 Page 2 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Energize the aircraft with an external DC - Power Supply ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). J. Operational Check of the Defueling Shut-off Valve (Figure 501) SUBTASK 710-002-A (1) Do the check below: (a) On the refueling/defueling control panel, open the defueling switch guard and set the switch to the OPEN position. Result: 1 On the refueling/defueling control panel, make sure that the defueling light comes on. 2 Make sure that the position indicator, at the defueling shut-off valve, shows the OPEN position. (b) On the refueling/defueling control panel, set the defueling switch to the CLOSED position. Result: 1 On the refueling/defueling control panel, make sure that the defueling light goes off. 2 Make sure that the position indicator, at the defueling shut-off valve, shows the CLOSED position. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close the defueling switch guard. (2) Deenergize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (3) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of fuel quantity indication harness is a part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations of the Maintenance Review Board Report (MRB). (4) Install access panel 155EZ/156EZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (5) Close the access panel 191BR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 28-23-07 Page 3 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

D D DET. B POSITION INDICATOR DET. C 145AMM280136.MCE D EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 28-23-07 Page 4 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-23-07-700-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH DRY WINGSTUB 3. DEFUELING SHUT-OFF VALVE - OPERATIONAL CHECK A. General (1) This task is a check of the defueling shut-off valve for operation. This valve permits the defueling of the tanks. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 191 191BR Wing-to-fuselage fairing 192 192AL Wing stub D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Operates the refueling/defueling control panel Center lower fairing 1 Monitors the defueling shut-off valve operation Wing stub I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Open access panel 191BR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100) to get access to the refueling/ defueling control panel. (2) Remove access panel 192AL (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100) to get access to the defueling shut-off valve. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-802-A/500 28-23-07 Page 5 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Energize the aircraft with an external DC - Power Supply ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). J. Operational Check of the Defueling Shut-off Valve (Figure 502) SUBTASK 710-003-A (1) Do the check below: (a) On the refueling/defueling control panel, open the defueling switch guard and set the switch to the OPEN position. Result: 1 On the refueling/defueling control panel, make sure that the defueling light comes on. 2 Make sure that the position indicator, at the defueling shut-off valve, shows the OPEN position. (b) On the refueling/defueling control panel, set the defueling switch to the CLOSED position. Result: 1 On the refueling/defueling control panel, make sure that the defueling light goes off. 2 Make sure that the position indicator, at the defueling shut-off valve, shows the CLOSED position. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Close the defueling switch guard. (2) Deenergize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (3) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of fuel quantity indication harness is a part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations of the Maintenance Review Board Report (MRB). (4) Install access panel 192AL (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (5) Close the access panel 191BR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100).
